title: Donald Trump says he is working to arrange meeting between Putin and Zelensky
byline: US President Donald Trump says he’s begun arranging a meeting between Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and Russian President Vladimir Putin after a summit today with Zelensky and European leaders.

title: Few showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: A few showers will occur in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Kandy, NuwaraEliya, Galle and Matara districts.

title: US State Department revokes 6,000 student visas
byline: The State Department has revoked more than 6,000 international student visas because of violations of US law and overstays, the department told the BBC.

title: Postal strike continues today – Unions seek President’s intervention
byline: The United Postal Trade Union Front states that the island-wide strike launched by postal workers will continue today (19) as well.

title: Former NLB Director Thusitha Halloluwa arrested
byline: Thusitha Halloluwa, the Former Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), who was evading court, has been arrested early this morning (19), Police stated.

title: Second reading of Gambling Regulatory Authority Bill in Parliament today
byline: The second reading of the Gambling Regulatory Authority Bill is scheduled to take place in Parliament today.

title: ‘Quazi court’ judge and wife arrested for soliciting bribe in Kalmunai
byline: A Quazi court judge in Kalmunai and his wife have been arrested by the Bribery Commission on allegations of soliciting a bribe.

title: Money printing will not lead to increase in inflation – Dy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Transport, Dr. Prasanna Gunasena claims that money printing will not lead to an increase in inflation in the country.

title: US would help assure Ukraine’s security in a peace deal, Trump tells Zelenskiy
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump told President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Monday that the United States would help guarantee Ukraine’s security in any deal to end Russia’s war there, though the extent of any assistance was not immediately clear.

title: ‘Skibidi’ and ‘tradwife’ among words added to Cambridge Dictionary
byline: “Skibidi”, “tradwife” and other slang terms popularised on social media are among thousands of new words to be added to the Cambridge Dictionary this year.

title: Man injured in shooting incident reported in Peliyagoda
byline: An individual has sustained injuries in a shooting incident reported in Peliyagoda, police said.

title: Man killed in Kalpitiya after two groups clash over personal dispute
byline: A 37-year-old individual has died following a clash between two groups in Kalpitiya last night (18), police stated.

title: ‘Quazi court’ judge and wife arrested in Kalmunai for soliciting bribe
byline: A ‘Quazi court’ judge in Kalmunai and his wife have been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption on allegations of soliciting a bribe.

title: Trump once again claims he stopped India, Pakistan war
byline: US President Donald Trump on Monday once again repeated his claim that he stopped the war between India and Pakistan.

title: 26,000 individuals inspected during special police operation
byline: A total of 748 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (18).

title: Three injured in head-on collision between bus and defender in Hingurakgoda
byline: At least three individuals have been hospitalized after a private passenger bus and a Sri Lanka Air Force Defender vehicle collided along the Hingurakgoda–Medirigiriya main road this morning, police stated.

title: Speaker says decision on no-confidence motion against Deputy Defence Minister will be announced later
byline: Speaker of House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne today (19) confirmed in Parliament that he has received a motion of no confidence against Deputy Minister of Defence Major General Aruna Jayasekara (Retd), signed by 31 opposition Members of Parliament.

title: Sri Lanka among top 10 source countries for foreign tourist arrivals in India
byline: Sri Lanka, the United States, Bangladesh, the United Kingdom, Australia and Canada were among the top 10 source countries for foreign tourist arrivals in India in the past five years, according to data shared by the Indian government.

title: Speaker to announce stance on No-Confidence Motion against Deputy Defence Minister
byline: Speaker of House Jagath Wickramaratne is expected to deliver his opinion today on the no-confidence motion submitted by the opposition against Deputy Minister of Defence Aruna Jayasekara.

title: ‘Call of Duty’ to fire starting gun at Gamescom trade show
byline: Mega-selling first-person shooter franchise “Call of Duty” will blow open the Gamescom video games trade fair Tuesday, headlining a wave of new releases as the industry weathers a rough patch.

title: Govt mulls using QR code to disburse fertilizer subsidies to farmers
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to a proposal to implement the fertilizer subsidy program for farmers through a digital system.

title: Former Deputy Director of Prison Hospital further remanded
byline: Former Deputy Director of the Prison Hospital, Dr. Hemantha Ranasinghe who was arrested on bribery charges, has been further remanded until August 26, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: ‘Admit until date’: US embassy in India warns against overstaying, explains how it can happen
byline: The US embassy in India issued a fresh warning to Indians against overstaying in the US and explained the difference between the ‘Admit until date’ and the expiry of the visa date.

title: OpenAI rolls out cheapest ChatGPT plan at US$4.6 in India to chase growth
byline: ChatGPT maker OpenAI on Tuesday launched ChatGPT Go, a new India-only subscription plan priced at 399 rupees (US$4.57) per month, its most affordable offering yet, as the company looks to deepen its presence in its second-largest market.

title: Video showing Sri Lankan worker moved by forklift prompts action from South Korea police
byline: South Korean police will launch a 100-day special crackdown on abuses against migrant workers, the Korean National Police Agency has said.

title: Acting Director of Police Cultural Division arrested on bribery charges further remanded
byline: The Acting Director of the Police Cultural Division, Senior Superintendent of Police (SSP) Sathish Gamage, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has been further remanded, until September 2.

title: Interviews begin to register new political parties, 47 shortlisted
byline: The National Election Commission states that interviews for new political parties applying for registration for the year 2025 have commenced.

title: Cabinet approves financial assistance for youth leaving institutional care
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to a joint proposal to provide financial assistance to selected groups of young people based on specified criteria.

title: Two businessmen held at BIA with smuggled cigarettes
byline: Two persons have been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake earlier today (19), while attempting to smuggle foreign-made cigarettes worth Rs. 5.94 million into the country.

title: Speaker endorses certificate on Sri Lanka Electricity (Amendment) Bill
byline: Speaker of House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne has endorsed the certificate on the Sri Lanka Electricity (Amendment) Bill.

title: Former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa has been further remanded by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Govt to seek bids to reopen Elephant Pass – North Saltern under PPP model
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to a cabinet paper presented to call for bidders at international level to reopen the Kurunchathivu (Elephant Pass – North) Saltern under a Public – Private Partnership methodology.

title: S&P SL20 crosses 6,000 for first time ever
byline: The S&P SL20 index of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE), which measures the performance of 20 of the largest and most liquid Sri Lankan companies, has crossed the 6,000 points mark for the first time today (19).

title: Man injured in Peliyagoda shooting succumbs
byline: An individual who was injured in a shooting incident in Peliyagoda earlier today (19), has succumbed to his injuries.

title: ‘Only CBSL can print money’ - Minister denies claims by various factions
byline: Deputy Minister of Economic Development Anil Jayantha has reiterated in Parliament that the government has not printed money as claimed by various factions.

title: Postal unions to continue strike action despite successful discussion at Presidential Secretariat
byline: Postal unions have announced that the strike action launched on Sunday (17), will continue despite successful discussions held at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Former NLB Director Thusitha Halloluwa remanded
byline: Former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), Thusitha Halloluwa, has been remanded until August 28 by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Ten suspects linked to criminal activities arrested with weapons in Gampaha
byline: A group of individuals connected to drug and organized crime networks in the Gampaha District have been arrested along with firearms, police stated.

title: Petition filed by Rajitha Senaratne seeking suspension of arrest warrant rejected
byline: The petition filed by former Minister Rajitha Senaratne, seeking a temporary suspension of the warrant issued for his arrest in connection with an investigation conducted by the Bribery Commission, has been rejected.
